Despite efforts to boost satellite and microwave links for partial connectivity during this outage, services remained inconsistent and slow. The timing of this disruption, just before the Pacific Games in Honiara, exacerbated the impact. (source: [SubtelForum](https://subtelforum.com/solomons-internet-mobile-hit-by-cable-damage/))

First subsea communications cable was a transatlantic telegraph cable [laid in 1858](https://www.history.com/this-day-in-history/first-transatlantic-telegraph-cable-completed), [connecting](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/7/7c/Transatlantic_submarine_cable_map.jpg) Newfoundland (a colony of the UK at the time, located in present day Canada) and Ireland. The first message was from Queen Victoria to President James Buchanan of the United States on their countries' mutual success on the cable they were using to communicate. It was made up of [509 letters and took 17 hours and 40 minutes](https://epe.lac-bac.gc.ca/100/205/301/ic/cdc/cable/fmessages.htm) to send.
